en: Work moves even a stone.

lt: Dievas davė dantis, duos ir duonos.
en: God gave teeth, He will also give bread.
The child is clever, the father is wise.
Work praises the master.
The goat is always grey.
Even a well-fed goat does not rest.
Weeds grow even without being sown.
Clever as a wise pig.
For the drunk, even the swamp feels dry.
Small but clever.
Hunchbacked, but wise.
Do not show wisdom in a quarrel.
Even in church, a fool gets beaten.
Foolish money means death.
Rent does not burden the horse.
The rich man carries his mind in his pocket.
If you do not plant an orchard, you will not get apples.
A rich man is considered wise.
To the drunk, even a goat seems like the devil.
It is better to be wise than rich.
Vodka is death for the stomach and the mind.
A fool teaches a fool.
Two fools make a third lose his mind.
A wide mouth means a narrow mind.
Tall as a lamb, but with little mind.
Gifted money does not warm.
A wise father does not teach foolishness.
In one’s own country, even the fence blooms.
Bad deeds sting the eyes.
Everyone hears only their own mind.

lt: Klausyk kitų, bet turėk savo protą.
en: Listen to others, but keep your own mind.
One must work with the mind, not with force.
The old are wise, the young are with heart.
Hasty work is carried off by the devil.
A punished task is like a witch in a fairy tale.

lt: Geras artojas gulsę ar pelkę aria.
en: A good plowman plows both meadow and swamp.
Old habits do not leave the plowman.

lt: Ir Amerikoje tinginys iš bado miršta.
en: Even in America, a lazy man dies of hunger.
Are you a fool or an American?
Even in Paris, oats cannot be smoked out.

lt: Be darbo ilgai, su darbu sunku.
en: Without work it is long, with work it is hard.

lt: Linas nepasėtas, o jau audžia drobę.
en: Flax is not yet sown, but already weaving linen.
Wise hair leaves a foolish head.
If you do not help friends, you will perish yourself.

lt: Senas ir jaunas turi tą patį protą.
en: The old and the young share the same mind.

lt: Ne jūra skandina laivus, o vėjai.
en: It is not the sea that sinks ships, but the winds.
The older the old man, the more foolish he is.
A madman always remains a madman.
Grey in the head, but folly in the tail.
Not everyone will find happiness in America.

lt: Gerai būti stipriam, bet geriau protingam.
en: It is good to be strong, but better to be wise.

lt: Jei Dievas nedavė proto, rykštė nepadės.
en: If God did not give wisdom, a rod will not help.

lt: Protingas prie ugnies šildo, kvailys dega.
en: The wise warm by the fire, the fool burns.

lt: Mokslininkas iš knygų, kvailys – iš galvos.
en: A scholar learns from books, a fool from his head.
Feathers adorn the bird, wisdom adorns the man.
The fool throws away, the wise picks up.
The clever always have the right answer.

lt: Didelis kaip bulius, kvailas kaip avinas.
en: Big as a bull, foolish as a ram.

lt: Gudrus liežuvis net iš gyvatės ištrauktų kiaušinį.
en: A clever tongue could pull an egg out of a snake.

lt: Kai senas gaidys gieda, jaunas mokosi.
en: When the old rooster crows, the young one learns.

lt: Kas daug kalba, tas mažai išmano.
en: He who talks much knows little.
Much wisdom brings many troubles.

lt: Galva kaip puodas, proto kaip košė.
en: A head like a pot, with brains like porridge.

lt: Didelis kaip velnias, kvailas kaip perkūnas.
en: Big as the devil, foolish as thunder.

lt: Kur velnias sėdi, ten perkūnas muša.
en: Where the devil sits, thunder strikes.

lt: Net jei kiaulė rūko, lūpa trumpa.
en: Even if the pig smokes, its lip is short.

lt: Varna nors mano, nors ne mano – vis tiek juoda.
en: Whether the crow is mine or not, it is still black.

lt: Dígestas medumi teptas – vis tiek dégutas.
en: Even if the crust is smeared with honey, it is still tar.
Hurry – today will end.
If you stand with your mouth wide open, a crow will fly in.

lt: Mergina ilgais plaukais, bet trumpu protu.
en: A girl with long hair but short mind.

lt: Kas turi ilgą liežuvį, tas trumpą protą.
en: He who has a long tongue has a short mind.

lt: Barzda kaip ožio, o išminties jokios.
en: A beard like a goat’s, but no wisdom.

lt: Akys mato toli, protas dar toliau.
en: The eyes see far, the mind even farther.
Plow deep and you will eat tastier bread.

lt: Blogos kojos ir geras protas sulydo iš kelio.
en: Bad legs and a good mind lead off the road.
The master's illness is the worker's health.

lt: Geriau paklausti vieno protingo, negu dešimties kvailių.
en: Better to ask one wise man than ten fools.

lt: Jauni šoka iš džiaugsmo, seni iš kvailumo.
en: The young dance with joy, the old with foolishness.

lt: Geriau su protingu, bet vargšu, negu su kvailiu turtingu.
en: Better with a wise poor man than with a foolish rich man.
Great wisdom can fit in a small head.

lt: Pasveikink su degtine – atsisveikinsi su protu.
en: Greet with vodka – say farewell to reason.

lt: Tuščia galva kaip puodas: proto jo užpildyti neįmanoma.
en: An empty head is like a pot: impossible to fill with sense.

lt: Nuo kiemo darbo susikaups kupra, bet ne pilvas.
en: Yard work gives you a hump, but not a full belly.

lt: Vienas vaikas ramina širdį, kitas gadina protą.
en: One child calms the heart, another spoils the mind.

lt: Klausaisi kalbų – veršis, žiūri darbą – vilkas.
en: Listening to talk – you’re a calf; watching the work – a wolf.

lt: Ieškok vaikino, kuris moka dirbti, ne tik gražiai šoka.
en: Seek a boy who knows how to work, not just how to dance.
Young in age, but wise.

lt: Tiek proto, kiek mėsos gaidžio kojoje.
en: As much sense as meat on a rooster’s leg.

lt: Tavo protas du kartus lengvesnis už žąsies išmatas.
en: Your mind is twice as light as goose droppings.
Only the wise speak creatively.

lt: Su protingu pasikalbėsi – sau proto pridėsi, su kvailiu – prarasi.
en: Talk with the wise and you’ll gain sense; with a fool, you’ll lose it.

lt: Tinginiui tingėti, girtuokliui išgerti, kvailiui pinigų nėr kur dėti.
en: A lazy man lazes, a drunkard drinks, a fool wastes money.

lt: Kai sunkumai spaudžia, tiki, kad ateis geresni laikai.
en: When hardships press, you believe better times will come.

lt: Girtuoklis išgeria, rūkorius išrūkymas – kvailio pinigai praeis.
en: The drunkard drinks, the smoker smokes – the fool’s money goes away.
Nine trades, the tenth is starvation.

lt: Tolimas giminaitis – didelė meilė, artimas – problemos.
en: A distant relative – great love; a close one – problems.
A rare guest is always dearer.

lt: Kaip silkė ant stalo, gerai per tris dienas.
en: Like a herring on the table, good for three days.

lt: Su kaimynais draugauk, bet tvorą laikyk.
en: Be friends with neighbors, but keep your fence.
Friends are temporary, but money is separate.
Borrowing is youth, asking is cunning.
A pedestrian is no friend to the rider.

lt: Nesi pasitikėk nauju draugu, kaip pavasario ledu.
en: Do not trust a new friend like spring ice.
If you want an enemy, lend to a friend.

lt: Nedraugauk su tais, kurie kitus šmeižia.
en: Do not befriend those who slander others.

lt: Nebijok protingo priešo – bijok kvailo draugo.
en: Do not fear a wise enemy – fear a foolish friend.
One’s own is a friend.

lt: Kalbi tik apie rūpesčius – prarasi draugus.
en: Speak only of troubles and you will lose friends.

lt: Ne kiekvienas draugas yra tikras draugas.
en: Not every friend is a true friend.
A miser considers a friend an enemy.
A cat is no friend to man.

lt: Jaunas su visais draugauja, senas niekam nereikalingas.
en: The young befriend all, the old are needed by none.
The evening is wiser than the morning.
There are no miracles without work.
A true friend is known in misfortune.
Do not fear what is beneath the earth.

lt: Kai du žmonės ginčijasi, trečias linksminasi.
en: When two people quarrel, the third enjoys.
Mind and tongue are good friends.

lt: Geriau vieną kartą pamatyti, negu šimtą kartų išgirsti.
en: Better to see once than to hear a hundred times.

lt: Geriau ne per daug kalbėti, o per daug daryti.
en: Better to do too much than to talk too much.
Love ignores age.
Fear to love and love with fear.
Love is bliss for mortals.
Love is both suffering and joy.
There is never enough love.
Love is stronger than death.
Love makes miracles happen.
The best love is reliable love.
Love is born from friendship.
Happiness is chance, friendship is choice.
Happy is he who loves.
True friendship does not count time.

lt: Geriausias draugas – tas, kuris žino tavo paslaptis.
en: The best friend is the one who knows your secrets.
Friendship is life’s gem.
A friend is a second family.

lt: Kartais tylinti yra geriausia draugystės kalba.
en: Sometimes silence is the best language of friendship.
Friendship grows stronger through suffering.

lt: Geras draugas dalijasi džiaugsmais ir rūpesčiais.
en: A good friend shares joys and worries.
A true friend is always near.

lt: Draugystė – tarsi medis, kuriam reikia laiko augti.
en: Friendship is like a tree that needs time to grow.
Time tests true friendship.
Friendship is the sun of life.
Friendship is the best gift.
A good friend is the greatest treasure.
A true friend does not judge.
Friendship is the foundation of trust.
Friendship is the bond of the heart.
Friendship is the spice of life.
Friendship is a gift of life.
A friend is a brother of the soul.
A friend always understands silence.
Friendliness creates miracles.
A good friend remains forever.
Friendship is a smile in life.
A good friend gives strength.
Friendship is an eternal flower.
A friend is a source of happiness.
True friendship lives forever.
Friendship is the tree of life.
Time strengthens friendship.
Friendship is light in the darkness.
A friend is a savior in life.
Friendship is the voice of the soul.
Friendship is an eternal bond.
Time clears misunderstandings in friendship.
True friendship is more valuable than gold.
Friendship is life’s gift.
Friendship gives wings.
Friendship is the warm hearth of home.
A good friend helps in the hardest times.
Friendship is the star of life.
Friendship strengthens the heart.
Friendship is the opposite of lies.
Friendship is true wealth.
Friendship is the best doctor.
Friendship heals the soul.
A good friend is a great blessing.
Friendship is love’s right hand.
Friendship is priceless.
Friendship is the extension of family.
True friends are eternal.
Friendship is the color of life.
Friendship is a happy life.
A good friend is the beginning of miracles.
Friendship is an eternal connection.
Friendship is the best wealth.
Friendship is the source of joy.
A good friend is life’s treasure.
Friendship gives strength.
True friendship is eternal.
Friendship is love’s brother.
Friendship is the source of happiness.
Friendship is the light of life.
Friendship is the warmth of the heart.
Friendship is joy.
Friendship is the bond between souls.
Friendship never dies.
Friendship is a true treasure.
Friendship always wins.
